Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lion's head with added red on mane and hind end of boar with red on haunch, both to right.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 454, no. B762)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0047) (Phase 1)
